Title: Golar LNG mulls fourth FLNG unit construction
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG said it will take a final investment decision (FID) on its fourth floating LNG unit under construction after it secures a charter agreement.
Author: JS

Title: Two sanctioned Russian LNG tankers spotted in close proximity in the Mediterranean
Description: The laden Metagas Energy and the ballast Mulan LNG tankers have been spotted next to each other in the East Mediterranean, raising questions about whether the vessels are preparing for a ship-to-ship LNG transfer of a cargo lifted from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas, Eni plan joint venture to boost regional LNG growth
Description: Malaysian state-owned Petronas and Italy’s Eni have signed an exclusive memorandum of understanding to form a joint venture holding company to manage selected upstream assets in Malaysia and Indonesia, aiming to bolster their LNG footprint in Southeast Asia.
Author: CK

Title: Osaka Gas agrees on 0.8 mtpa long-term LNG supply deal with Adnoc
Description: Japanese utility Osaka Gas has agreed to buy 0.8 mtpa of LNG from Abu Dhabi’s state-owned Adnoc, with deliveries expected to start in 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate Energy to buy an LNG ship this year for first FSRU conversion, expanding fleet
Description: Floating LNG infrastructure provider Excelerate Energy  plans to acquire an LNG carrier this year for its first floating storage regasification unit conversion, further expanding its fleet.
Author: CK

Title: Tepco delays construction schedule for Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear units, pushing back restart
Description: Japanese utility Tokyo Electric Power Co., or Tepco, has postponed the construction schedule for power supply equipment at its idle Units 6 and 7 of the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant in Niigata Prefecture, further delaying the restart of these two units.
Author: CK
